metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000117 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Python Software Foundation CPython version From 3.2 until 3.6.4 on Windows contains a Buffer Overflow vulnerability in os.symlink() function on Windows that can result in Arbitrary code execution, likely escalation of privilege. This attack appears to be exploitable via a python script that creates a symlink with an attacker controlled name or location. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 3.7.0 and 3.6.5.

criterions.comment: python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
